name: TreeViewRoot
description:
Groups all parts of the tree view.
Renders a `<div>` element.

aria-label.description: The accessible label for the tree.

aria-labelledby.description: The id of the element that labels the tree.

defaultExpanded.description: The default value of the items that should be expanded (uncontrolled).

defaultSelected.description:
The default selected value(s) (uncontrolled).
- For single selection: string | null
- For multiple selection: string[]

expanded.description: The controlled value of the items that should be expanded.

loopFocus.description: Whether focus should loop from last to first item and vice versa.

onExpandedChange.description: Callback invoked when an item's expansion state changes.
onExpandedChange.detailedType:
| ((
    expanded: string[],
    details: BaseUIChangeEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

onItemHighlighted.description: Callback invoked when an item is highlighted (for virtualization scroll management).
onItemHighlighted.detailedType:
| ((
    value: string | undefined,
    details: BaseUIGenericEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

onSelectedChange.detailedType:
| ((
    selected: TreeViewSelected,
    details: BaseUIChangeEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

selected.description:
The controlled selected value(s).
- For single selection: string | null
- For multiple selection: string[]

virtualized.description:
Whether the tree is virtualized.
When true, you should use explicit index props on items.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: TreeView.Root.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: TreeView.Root.State,
  ) => ReactElement)
